attributes.action: To give assistant/therapy dogs the same recognition as Guide and Hearing dogs.
attributes.background: Guide/Hearing Dogs are recognised by shops to give them admission. However, therapy and assistance don't have the rights to enter establishments with those they support, this disadvantages the person the dog is with. I am looking to give these useful dogs the same recognition in law.

attributes.action: Remove all American military bases from UK soil.
attributes.background: A relic of the second world war, the UK is littered with underused American military bases, thousands of acres of beautiful UK countryside is being left to waste with no advantage to the UK at all, it's just waste land, not even wildlife is welcome.
attributes.additional_details:
The United States has thousands of acres of UK soil for their own military use which is of very little advantage to us, they provide minimal economic benefits or defence as they are self sufficient and more likely to attract enemies to our shores.
 These bases are generally in prime locations and could be used in countless ways to boost our economy, housing, farming or simply given back to nature to enhance our countryside. American military bases are of no use to the UK, take our country back.

attributes.action: Stop fines to parents who holiday in term time or stop companies raising prices.
attributes.background: It's not fair or right for holiday companies to raise prices during school holidays and for local authorities to fine parents for taking their children out of school during term time. Some companies charge hundred so of pounds more and the majority of ordinary working people are being penalised.
attributes.additional_details: It's not difficult to find the evidence just search for any holiday during term time and check the dates either side of the school holidays!

attributes.action: Expel all US military personnel from the UK, except 2 military attaches, please.
attributes.background:
US forces, that came to fight Hitler in 1941, now occupy 10 UK bases, using NATO treaties from 1951 & 52. The Berlin wall fell on 9/11/1989. 
In Jan 2017 Trump declared NATO obsolete.
Peace is restored and, as promised by Magna Carta in 1215, foreign soldiers and arms must be removed.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-nato-obsolete-idUSKBN14Z0YO
http://www.caab.org.uk/the-american-bases/where-are-the-bases 
US troops in the UK under NATO SOFA 1951 and the Visiting Forces Act of 1952. 
Magna Carta Clause (51) As soon as peace is restored, we will remove from the kingdom all the foreign knights, bowmen, their attendants, and the mercenaries that have come to it, to its harm, with horses and arms. https://www.bl.uk/magna-carta/articles/magna-carta-english-translation

attributes.action: Teach taxes, financial situations, bills, and how to handle money, in schools
attributes.background: This petition is for taxes, bills, loans, mortgages and money/bank situations to be taught in secondary schools, as I have left school myself and starting to deal with financial situations etc. I am oblivious to financial dealings and friends of my age also have no knowledge on money transactions.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL.
attributes.background: Communication  in children is very important. But what happens when the only way to communicate is by sign? Not being able to communicate and make friends can lower a child's self-esteem.Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL in schools.

attributes.action: Ensure  the UK can trade tariff free in the EU single market after Brexit
attributes.background: It is vital for jobs and UK prosperity that the UK does not cut off the inportant markets of the EU to UK business after Brexit. Our Financial services are the backbone of our economy and must have full passporting rights going forward. The industrial sector too must not be penalised for Brexit

attributes.action: Ban all landlords from stopping tenants having pets.
attributes.background: Currently in the uk millions of people are either private or housing association tenants, that rises each year. At present a landlord can tell a tenant if they can or can't have a pet. Approximately 7 million+ animals enter shelters each year. No landlord should have the right to disallow pets.

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be allowed with a specific liecence per event
attributes.background:
Fireworks can cause injury to bystanders.  
Fireworks cause distress people's pets. 
Fireworks should only be ignited by a pyrotechnics person.
Fireworks should not be allowed on private property they should only be allowed in a designated public area with a specific license per event.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the risks fireworks bring it is requested that they are only ignited by a professional pyrotechnics person.  They should only be allowed in designated public places. They should require a licence from the local council. This will safe guard children and animals and ensure this safety risk and noise pollution is managed in a fair socially considered manner

attributes.action: Stop HS2 tunnel plan in Longsight Manchester
attributes.background: As a Longsight resident, I have not received information about how the tunnel affects me or what my rights are. Speaking to other residents they feel the same. The impact of this on people's lives and future plans if they end of selling has to be reviewed and the plans on the HS2 tunnel halted.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cars to pass horses at no more than 15mph
attributes.background: There is an increase in the number of tragic accidents caused by vehicles passing horses far too quickly and not allowing sufficient room to pass.   This can be reduced by making it a legal requirement for vehicles to pass slow and wide.

attributes.action: Revision of Universal Credit system for people with mental health issues
attributes.background: Currently the Government is in the process of transfer all authorities from ESA to Universal Credit.  Therefore, people with mental health issues are struggling to get the financial support they are entitled to as with the new system focuses on work rather than understanding of mental health needs.
attributes.additional_details: Not only is the application process difficult to complete once the claim is running unlike ESA that respected a GP's fit note Universal Credit expects you to fulfil commitments some of which are unrealistic, for example arrangement of face-to-face interview at the job centre for somebody suffering from agoraphobia... If commitments are not adhered to then you are sanctioned ...i am sure you get the picture and ask you to please support this petition.

attributes.action: Make work experience a compulsory part of the Yr 9 and Yr 11 curriculum again.
attributes.background: We are being made to make choices that may shape our entire career without having been given the opportunity to experience a working environment.  If work experience was compulsory we could experience different types of jobs and make informed choices about what qualifications we wanted to pursue.
attributes.additional_details: If 2 opportunities were given in Yr 9 and Yr 11 to undertake 2 weeks of work experience young people would be able to make better informed GCSE and A Level choices.  It would also allow them the opportunity to build their character by recognising what key skills they may need to develop further.  It also allows them potential segues into jobs when they reach school leaving age.  This opportunity for personal development should be just as essential as the rest of the curriculum.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for young adults under the age of 18
attributes.background: The minimum wage being £3.87 for 16 and 17 year olds can not only put young people off working, but also reduces their financial independence. It should be raised to at least £4.50 so these under 18 year olds can get a worthwhile and rewarding payment for their labour time.

attributes.action: Make the BBC a subscription-only channel and abolish the TV licence.
attributes.background: In 2016, people should not be forced to have a TV licence when they may not watch BBC programming. BBC could become a subscription-only channel akin to HBO (US) or a streaming service like Netflix.

attributes.action: Referendum on replacing the House of Lords with a fully elected upper house
attributes.background: The current House of Lords does not reflect the UK population and is currently non elected, this means they has the power to block legislation that could be beneficial for the UK, without actually being elected by any British citizens. Hold a referendum to see if Britons want an elected upper house
attributes.additional_details: The UK is one of the only countries that includes non-elected religious leaders in its Upper House, the only other modern day country that has this is Iran.

attributes.action: Force manufacturers to tell consumers how long their products will last.
attributes.background: Planned obsolescence is a policy of intentionally designing a product so it will become obsolete after a certain period of time. The practice is immoral to the consumer, wastes resources and is harmful to the environment. Manufacturers should be legally required to state how long a product will last
attributes.additional_details:
Planned obsolescence is an immoral practice common among manufacturers.  

The law should force manufacturers to tell consumers how long their products will last as well as informing consumers for how long spare parts for the product will be available. 

This could save consumers thousands of pounds, prevent environmental waste and potentially reinvigorate the repair industry.

attributes.action: Create policy, guidance for children's services, legal services and parents.
attributes.background: It is felt that there is a lack of awareness and support for children who are caught up in contact and custody disputes. There is a lack of guidance and support to help children have a healthy ongoing relationship with both parents and in doing so maintain their psychological health.
attributes.additional_details: I am raising awareness of the vulnerability of children caught in high conflict contact and custody disputes and their need to access specialist assessment and, where appropriate, intervention, to ensure their improved opportunities for ongoing relationships with both parents, and their long term psychological health. In doing this there is a need for policy/legislation/guidance for children's services, legal services and parents to raise a concern and have access to the support to resolve it.

attributes.action: Scrap the idea to hand over maintenance responsibility from Network Rail to TOCs
attributes.background: Her Majesty's Government announced[1] a decision to instead of having a state run company maintaining Britain's rail network to instead hand over the responsibility to private TOC's. Her Majesty's Government has previously privatized the maintenance with disastrous results[2][3][4]
attributes.additional_details:
[1] http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/12/02/exclusive-network-rail-stripped-control-britains-train-tracks/

[2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bexley_railway_station#History

[3] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hatfield_rail_crash#Cause

[4]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potters_Bar_rail_accidents#2002

attributes.action: Establish an independent inquiry into Child Sexual Exploitation in Telford
attributes.background: Telford & Wrekin has more reports of Child Sexual Exploitation per capita than anywhere else in the UK. There are 15 reports per 10,000 people in Telford & Wrekin compared to 6.4 in Rotherham. An independent inquiry would establish (as it did in Rotherham) the facts behind this disturbing statistic.
attributes.additional_details: Telford has been described as the "child sex capital of Britain". There could be as many as 2,300 victims in Telford & Wrekin - 40% more than Rotherham's 1,400 - based on being 2 and a half times more likely to be a victim in Telford & Wrekin which has 60% of the population of Rotherham.

attributes.action: Implement the recommendations of the Cttee on Economic, Social & Cultural Rights
attributes.background: The UN Committee on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights issued a damning report on the UK’s compliance with international human rights law, and made 60 specific recommendations. The government must explain to Parliament and the British public how it intends to implement them.
attributes.additional_details:
The government missed the opportunity of the 2016 Autumn statement to start decisively allocating the necessary resources to fulfil the economic and social rights recognised in international human rights law. 

Find out more background information here: http://www.just-fair.co.uk/2016-concluding-observations

The UK’s human rights record will be reviewed again in the UN Universal Periodic Review in May 2017.

attributes.action: Britain to Rejoin the European Union After Brexit.
attributes.background: We the voting public call upon the British government to prepare the required documentation needed for a new referendum, this time on rejoining the European Union to be submitted one day after the pending exit has been completed.
attributes.additional_details: It would be undemocratic to reverse the results of the last referendum on brexit, however with so many facts now available which contradict the information many leave voters based their voting opinions on, and with so many people coming of voting age who would of voted to remain but were at the time considered too young it is safe to presume another referendum, this time on rejoining Europe would have a very different result.

attributes.action: The UK parliament should close down this petition website.
attributes.background: The UK parliament should close down this petition website. It is being used by the vocal minority to pursue debates on niche issues that do not concern the British public as a whole.

attributes.action: Fund the NHS more money so that ambulance response times improve
attributes.background: Ambulances take a long time to get to people. My Grandfather broke his leg and the ambulance didn't get to him till an hour after being called. If the ambulance had responded sooner then his pain would've been relieved quicker. Give more money to the NHS and stuff like this would be prevented

attributes.action: Request that the government revoke Govia's contract for Southern Rail
attributes.background:
Southern Rail customers are fed up with the continued poor service -cancelled trains, late trains, trains will less cars than normal, poor compensation.
This is also starting to affect employees and employers when people are continually late or need to leave early

attributes.action: Make all CCG's ensure access to Minor injury unit or A& E within 15 mile radius
attributes.background: East Riding CCG is downgrading and closing minor injury unit and ceasing services such as community X Ray, therapies, rehab beds in two isolated coastal towns, one of which, Withernsea has low car ownership. The replacement service is 29 miles and not accessible by public transport.
attributes.additional_details:
Rural communities particularly those on the coasts receive poorer services overall and rural poverty and isolation is ignored because it is spread and hidden.
In paces where there are seasonal employment car ownership is lower.
In the case of Withernsea, residents will have no choice but to go to the full A and E at Hull Royal which like most is already under pressure.

attributes.action: Constitutional change proposed via referenda to require a two-thirds majority.
attributes.background: In many other countries, such as the USA and France, major constitutional proposals requires a two-thirds majority to effect lasting change. Referenda on EU membership or Scottish independence have required a simple majority only, which binds future generations to the current whim of the electorate.
attributes.additional_details: In the wake of the recent EU referendum, polls have suggested that public opinion shifted in the wake of that vote and as more information became available to inform voters. A referendum on a single day merely reflects the shifting opinion at that point in time, which is why other constitutions require a two-thirds, rather than a simple majority. Major change cannot be left to a simple majority, because of the repercussions for future generations and the consequences for the nation.

attributes.action: Ban extending dog leads in the uk
attributes.background: After a close friend lost her beloved pet in an accident involving an extendable dog lead I want the government to ban these dangerous leads. Not only have several pets been killed but adults and children are also at risk to injury.
attributes.additional_details: As a nation of pet lovers we try to keep our pets safe and away from harm. Extendable leads provide the owner of a dog "control" from a distance but actually they do more harm than good. These leads provide little or no control over your dog and at times the failure of the mechanism in these leads have led to the tragic deaths of several dogs. Extendable leads dont keep your pets safe they are a tragedy waiting to happen.

attributes.action: Teach about lesbian-specific protection in schools.
attributes.background: While every school teaches students to use a condom to protect from pregnancy and STI's, very few even mention lesbian-specific protection.  Young women should be formally educated on the risks they face when engaging in same-sex sexual activities and how best to avoid them.
attributes.additional_details:
I was shocked to learn at the age of eighteen (two years after the age whereby one can consent to having sex) that lesbian-specific protection exists. 

From asking people on my social media, only 18/100 people were taught about this protection in school, while 32/100 knew it existed.  

There is a call for homosexual sex-ed lessons in schools, but lesbian protection should be taught as a priority as a matter of promoting safe sex.  Everyone should know how to protect themselves and stay safe.

attributes.action: Government should stage a new cultural Festival of Britain
attributes.background: The Opening Ceremonies of the 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games did much to tell the world what makes Britain Great.  Let's have a cultural Festival of Britain in this post Brexit climate to demonstrate what an amazing nation this is and that we continue to welcome the world
attributes.additional_details: Let's celebrate what makes this nation great in the ways that we did over 2012. Let's reach out and show the world what a vibrant and amazing country we live in, what we have to give to the world through culture and the wider creative sectors which lie at the heart of our thriving knowledge economy

attributes.action: Pressure African nations to find and prosecute the buyers of Albino bodyparts
attributes.background: Albinos in East Africa are murdered,limbs cut off and sold. Few are prosecuted due to secrecy and corruption.Witch doctors make medicine from limbs for luck and wealth, superstition is rife.The market is fuelled by money.Pressurise governments of East Africa to investigate an prosecute all involved.
attributes.additional_details: The UN and EU statistics can be viewed but too long to submit. Of 74 murders only 4 prosecutions have been made since 2002 in Tanzania. Albinos are at risk of abductions, killings and mutilations in at least 27 countries.Pre-election murders go up, believed to be political superstition.In Malawi the figures are rising.International pressure is needed to make the governments openly investigate who is buying human bodyparts to prosecute them.Tell AN the UK concern of contravention of human rights.

attributes.action: student loan forgiveness for teachers in shortage recruitment subjects.
attributes.background:
The UK currently has a recruitment issue / teachers leaving the profession.

Why can't the government wipe student loans of teachers that have given 3 years service or more in subject shortage areas such as Mathematics, Computer Science and Physics...
attributes.additional_details:
Currently offered is a large bursary to become a teacher, normally this sum is larger than the average first year wage of M1.This is attracting individuals to join the profession for a year and then leave.

By offering a student loan forgiveness for subject shortage areas this would give current teachers an insentive to stay in the profession.

It would also help boost the income of teachers lower down the M scale as it is one less expenditure from the already low starting teaching salary.

attributes.action: Require better publicity for proposed traffic restrictions.
attributes.background: Existing requirements to consult on proposals for traffic calming, lower speed limits, waiting restrictions, etc are inadequate to ensure that everyone affected by them is made aware. People who use the roads but do not live in the area often do not know what is planned until it is too late.
attributes.additional_details: As a minimum, signs of adequate font size to be readable from a passing vehicle should be provided along affected sections of road, showing what is proposed (e.g. 'Proposed 20mph Speed Limit'), with a telephone number and/or website address where further details can be obtained and objections made. The road network performs a vital function for the whole of society, so it is essential that a balance is struck between the desires of residents and the needs of the wider community.

attributes.action: Change school hours to 9am - 4pm everywhere in the U.K.
attributes.background:
I want action to take place because as an 18-year-old, I understand how majority of students feel about the pressure of getting to school on time.

I love education and learning but to be threatened to get kicked out because I'm late by a couple of minutes shouldn't be an excuse to stop me.
attributes.additional_details:
As a teenager, I asked my peers at Bacon's College what they would prefer, school to start at the times it is already at or 9am - 4pm. 98.7% of my peers agreed that it should start later because of the fact that they are always tired in the morning and can never concentrate properly.

Biologically speaking, teenagers don't have good focus or attention until after 10am, this evidence can be read about in this BBC article: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-34192371. 

Schools in countries such as Finland are performing better and they don't give their students homework nor do they start school as early as us. You can find this proof anywhere on the internet.

attributes.action: Introduce tax on disposable coffee cups to reduce waste
attributes.background:
2,500,000,000 disposable coffee cups are thrown away in the UK each year. 

1 in 400 are recycled. The coffee industry and chains are NOT doing enough voluntarily to reduce waste. The tax for plastic bags worked-use fell massively. Let's consider the environment and do the same with coffee cups.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to start reducing our waste now before it is too late.

100,000 trees are used for the cups each year: 
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/oct/05/uks-billions-of-takeaway-cups-could-each-take-30-years-to-break-down

Ministers reject coffee cup tax despite massive wastage: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/oct/31/ministers-reject-calls-for-charge-on-disposable-coffee-cups

Plastic bag reductions: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36917174

attributes.action: Do not stop PSA Prostate Specific Antigen tests for men.
attributes.background: I have have suffered prostate cancer and had a prostatectomy. The issue was highlighted following a blood test for PSA. I had no symptoms, don't smoke or drink and keep fit
attributes.additional_details:
It was the my manager who encouraged me to go for a test following a friend suffering the disease. Had I not had the test I would now be in the advanced stages of cancer and do not know how long I would have to live. 
Further to this I know of three other men with the same story.
If this is stopped men will die.PSA test will show your individual PSA level and enable you monitor of your reading. Its a simple blood test and nothing more.

attributes.action: Stop car insurance companies increasing prices after a non-fault accident.
attributes.background: Currently, insurers can charge more for customers who have been involved in a non- fault accident in the past 5 years. As an 18 year old, I was involved in one and my insurance costs went up by 20% as a result. I fail to see why people who are not at fault for an accident should be punished for it.

attributes.action: Stop mobile phone companies taking back your data allowance that you pay for
attributes.background:
Most of us have a monthly contract with mobile phone companies, with minutes, texts and data depending on what contract you choose.
We agree a term of contract and pay to there conditions but I want to know why every month they reset your data allowance even if I have 1gb left.
attributes.additional_details:
So I'm with a mobile company and I get 3gb data with minutes and texts.
By the time the month is up I may be left with around 1gb data yet they take it back.
The thing is you have paid for it so what gives them the rights to take, reset and lose what you had.
Why can't they add it into your next months.
It unfair!!

attributes.action: Provide parents with a death certificate for the loss of any confirmed pregnancy
attributes.background:
The parents of every confirmed miscarriage, before the viability age of 24 weeks, should have the option to a certificate of death.

I honestly believe this small change could massively help with the grieving process of many mother and fathers that sadly lose their babies so early.
attributes.additional_details:
I suffered an early miscarriage before the stage of a first scan. The only thing we have from our baby is pictures of positive tests. It would have brought us so much comfort just to have something to prove that our baby existed.

Some mothers have to give birth to their perfectly formed child. There is then no paper proof of their baby existing. 
No matter what stage of pregnancy, these babies are loved and a loss is a massively traumatic experience. Something so easy could help ease this pain.

attributes.action: Bring back licences for businesses wanting to sell tobacco related products.
attributes.background: At this time there is no regulation for the selling of tobacco related products which is, in my opinion, 'feeding' the sales of illicit goods.  I would like to see the Government bring back licencing to work the same way as an alcohol licence with the decision process being through local councils.

attributes.action: Upon leaving the EU, immediately pay £350 million per week to the NHS.
attributes.background: It is widely held that to ignore the Referendum vote  would be a dereliction of democracy. Equally derelict would be to ignore the rest of the deal, garishly displayed on the Leavers' bus. To respect part of the deal and to ignore the rest is fraudulent. We want hypothecated inflation-adjusted funds
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=the+leave+bus&biw=1366&bih=565&tbm=isch&imgil=rUuQGgKEqz2V6M%253A%253BAuHiIFjCc5DKkM%253Bhttp%25253A%25252F%25252Fwww.itv.com%25252Fnews%25252Fwestcountry%25252Fstory%25252F2016-05-11%25252Feu-referendum-vote-leave-campaign-gets-underway-in-cornwall%25252F&source=iu&pf=m&fir=rUuQGgKEqz2V6M%253A%252CAuHiIFjCc5DKkM%252C_&usg=__pVjQA6MrJ7G5fZBt4Ff6UawN9_E%3D&ved=0ahUKEwjLjua7o_bRAhVQF8AKHfc5BmUQyjcIJQ&ei=zLKVWMt40K6ABvfzmKgG#imgrc=Jr4HD7qgUDrKKM:

attributes.action: Defer invocation of Article 50 until DJ Trump and M Pence have left office.
attributes.background: At a time of unprecented instability in the United States of America we need to stand shoulder to shoulder with our European allies in order to promote and maintain global stability and democratic values.
attributes.additional_details: Invoking article 50 is likely to destabilise our economy at a time of heightened global threat. Leaving the EU at this time will render us highly dependent on the United States of America. Under the leadership of Donald Trump and/or Mike Pence we cannot assume that our national interest will be best served by this alliance.

attributes.action: Make PIP more accessible to people with rare illnesses
attributes.background: I have suffered from Guillain Barre Syndrome for five years. I have pins and needles in my feet which make it very painful to walk, and muscle weakness and pains in my arms. I am currently waiting a decision from the Upper Tribunal. There are many other people out there in the same position.
attributes.additional_details: There are approximately 1 in every 200,000 get GBS and 20% of these have some form of residual issues. I returned to work because I wanted to try and get back to normal. This hasn't happened and I had to became part-time. I only work two days at a time because I get too tired. I have to get taxi's when I go anywhere because I am unable to use public transport unless someone is with me. Nerve damage means I will not recover. Disabled people need your help.

attributes.action: Increase defence spending to 3% GDP as US calls for NATO allies to do more.
attributes.background:
The US accounts for 72% of total spending in NATO. 
President-elect Donald J Trump has called for the remaining members to pay their share, 2% GDP, on defence. 
The UK has an opportunity to lead the way and break through the 2% of GDP, showing Europe that we must take the NATO alliance seriously
attributes.additional_details:
The UK pays in more to defence than any other member of NATO outside of the USA. 
By further increasing our spending to 3%, almost a match to the USA, we solidify our commitment to NATO, showing America that we support the President's call and are the USA's true friend and ally in this matter.
We will show other large NATO nations that they must do more to help the defence of the alliance.
http://www.nato.int/nato_static_fl2014/assets/pdf/pdf_2016_01/20160129_160128-pr-2016-11-eng.pdf

attributes.action: Fathers to have 50/50 rights and stricter penalties for breach of court order
attributes.background: I want fathers to have equal rights in a family court and not just automatically given to the mother. Also a stronger penalty for breach of court order. With the person who is breachig the court order liable to pay costs towards a new court order.
attributes.additional_details:
Time and time again fathers are being stopped from seeing their children. Even with a visitation order, the ex partner can stop them and have to be taken back to court at the expense of the father again. 

It's a lengthy and costly process and the mother has automatic residency rights over the child. The current procedures don't do enough to stop a mother from blocking contact with their children. 

If the mother blocks contact without a valid excuse, she should be made to pay future court fees

attributes.action: Take action on the greatest Humanitarian Crisis since 1945
attributes.background:
We must act now
The United Nations have said this week that we are facing the greatest humanitarian crisis since 1945.
20 million people face starvation in Yemen, Somalia, South Sudan & Nigeria. 
Unicef has already warned 1.4m children could starve to death this year.
attributes.additional_details:
Please read this article and watch the video to inform yourself on this urgent issue:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-39238808

We must listen to the United Nations, this is a desperate and dire situation. We are all citizens of this world and have a global responsibility to each other.
We need more funding/ resources to tackle this inadmissible situation.

This is not a political battle, this concerns the lives of millions, whatever your views, we cannot allow starvation to continue.

attributes.action: Help from the NHS to provide more mental health support for people aged 16-18.
attributes.background: The NHS have many adolescent services but long waiting lists mean that support is unavailable when people most critically need it. When people reach 17, they no longer fit the criteria for an adolescent patient, but don't fit in the age range for adult services, so they are left without support.
attributes.additional_details: Being left to find private services at the age of 17 can be very difficult for families as a result of the very high prices. The cost of services can prevent these people from getting the support they need. This time without care can be very detrimental to a young person with poor mental health, so therefore the gap between adolescent and adult services needs to be filled.

attributes.action: Abolish old & outdated leasehold law for all leasehold flats. Make them freehold
attributes.background: Crooked & unregulated freeholders hold leaseholders to ransom with high fees. When we buy a flat, we should also own a section of the outside part of the building and parts of the communal area. Responsibility should lie with the flat owner, not the freeholder. Commonhold law may be required here.
attributes.additional_details: The freeholder of the building should be forced to sell part of their freehold (for a cheap price) at the start and then eventually force them to give up the freehold. Leaseholders in UK are being conned and ripped off by unregulated freeholders.

attributes.action: Give all airfields statutory protection as Valuable Habitats for flora & fauna
attributes.background:
Airfields are under threat for development for housing
Airfields provide havens for flora and fauna as they are never ploughed or sprayed with chemicals - occasional aircraft movement has little effect on plants animals & reptiles
Airfields provide an open space amenity for local people
attributes.additional_details: Airfields are being closed by developers destroying significant areas of natural habitat within airfield boundaries. All airfields should be reclassified as "Valuable Habitats" and given protected status to save rare plants, animals, reptiles, insects and invertebrates under The Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2010

attributes.action: Service charges & tips should be given to staff automatically by law
attributes.background:
The TV chef Michel Roux Jr has admitted his Michelin-starred Le Gavroche restaurant keeps 100% of the service charge added to bills instead of distributing the cash to staff in addition to their pay.

The government ran a consultation this summer but no law has been passed so far.
